intro: Bourreria homalophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burrhead, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a serrated margin. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and are followed by distinctive burr-like seed pods. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments.
